alert.note: Alert for Bee; Duval; Jim Wells; La Salle; Live Oak; McMullen; Webb (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Corpus Christi (Corpus Cristi, Victoria and Laredo)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 07 at 2:16PM CST until January 09 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Corpus Christi
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED MONDAY... .A cold front will move across South Texas Monday. As a result, strong to very strong northwest winds and low relative humidity values are expected to develop, and result in Critical fire weather conditions. These conditions are expected to begin Monday afternoon and persist through Tuesday afternoon. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM MONDAY TO 6 PM CST TUESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Corpus Christi has issued a Red Flag Warning for low relative humidity and strong, gusty winds, which is in effect from 3 PM Monday to 6 PM CST Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...La Salle, McMullen, Live Oak, Bee, Webb, Duval and Jim Wells. * TIMING...Monday afternoon through Tuesday afternoon. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 16 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Up to 82. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Residents are urged to exercise care with respect to all outdoor activities that could inadvertently cause wildfires. Report wildfires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office.

area.areaDesc: Bee; Duval; Jim Wells; La Salle; Live Oak; McMullen; Webb
